DataElement.preferredName: Miniscrew Temporary Anchorage Device Surgical Procedure Placement Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A small screw of between 6-14mm in length placed between the roots of a tooth for purposes of anchoring the tooth during orthodonic treatment._A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery._Position or arrangement, as of the teeth; the state of being placed or arranged, as the assignment of a person to a appropriate clinical study._Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.
